meta.defaultDescription: Barbacane - The spec-driven API gateway built in Rust. Your OpenAPI and AsyncAPI specs become your gateway configuration.

footer.tagline: The spec-driven API gateway built in Rust. Your OpenAPI and AsyncAPI specs become your gateway configuration.

hero.title: Your spec is your
hero.description: Stop maintaining two sources of truth. Barbacane uses your OpenAPI and AsyncAPI specifications as the single source of truth for routing, validation, authentication, and event bridging.

problem.title: The
problem.card1Description: Your OpenAPI spec defines your API, but your gateway has its own configuration. They inevitably diverge, causing bugs and security issues.
problem.card2Description: Teams spend hours syncing gateway config with API specs, debugging mismatches, and fixing inconsistencies that shouldn't exist.

solution.title: The
solution.subtitle: One spec. Zero configuration drift. Automatic enforcement.
solution.step1DescriptionEnd: extensions for auth, rate limiting, and routing.
solution.step2DescriptionEnd: to generate an optimized binary artifact. Validation happens at compile time.
solution.step3Description: Deploy the artifact to your gateway. Routing, validation, auth — everything works exactly as specified.

features.title: Everything you need in an API gateway
features.subtitle: Built in Rust for speed and safety. Extended with WebAssembly for flexibility.

requestValidation.title: Request Validation
requestValidation.description: Automatic JSON Schema validation for bodies, parameters, and headers. Invalid requests never reach your backend.

authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.description: Built-in JWT, API Key, and OAuth2 authentication. Configured directly in your OpenAPI security schemes.

blazingFast.title: Blazing Fast
blazingFast.description: Sub-microsecond routing and validation. Built on Rust, Tokio, and Hyper for maximum performance.

wasmPlugins.title: WASM Plugins
wasmPlugins.description: Extend functionality with WebAssembly plugins. Sandboxed execution means plugins can't crash your gateway.

observability.title: Observability
observability.description: Prometheus metrics, OpenTelemetry traces, and structured logging. Full visibility into your API traffic.

asyncApi.title: AsyncAPI & Event Bridging
asyncApi.description: Bridge HTTP to event-driven systems. Route requests to Kafka, NATS, or AWS Lambda using AsyncAPI specs.

controlDataPlane.title: Control & Data Plane Split
controlDataPlane.description: Autonomous data planes that run independently. Zero-downtime deployments with hot-reload updates pushed from the control plane.

webUi.title: Web UI
webUi.description: Visual control plane for managing projects, specs, plugins, and deployments. No YAML wrestling required.

edgeReady.title: Edge Ready
edgeReady.description: Data planes are lightweight compiled artifacts. Deploy anywhere — cloud, on-prem, edge locations, or embedded devices.

architecture.title: Enterprise-grade
architecture.subtitle: Separate control plane and data plane for maximum resilience and flexibility.

controlPlane.title: Control Plane
controlPlane.description: The management layer for your API gateway fleet. Handles configuration, compilation, and deployment orchestration.

dataPlane.title: Data Plane(s)
dataPlane.description: The runtime layer that handles actual API traffic. Fully autonomous — keeps running even if the control plane is down.

useCases.title: Built for teams who take APIs seriously

platformTeams.title: Platform Teams
platformTeams.description: Building an internal developer platform? Barbacane enforces consistent API standards and policies automatically.

apiProduct.title: API Product Companies
apiProduct.description: Exposing public APIs? Barbacane ensures your contracts are strictly enforced and your documentation is always accurate.

enterprises.title: Enterprises Modernizing
enterprises.description: Migrating from legacy gateways? Barbacane's spec-first approach brings order to complex API landscapes.

openSource.title: No enterprise edition. No feature gating.
openSource.description: Barbacane is fully open source under the Apache 2.0 license. Every feature is available to everyone. We make money through consulting, support, and training — not by holding features hostage.

cta.title: Ready to simplify your API gateway?

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.q1Answer: Yes. Barbacane is 100% open source under the Apache 2.0 license. There's no "enterprise edition" with gated features. Every capability is available to everyone, forever. Our business model is based on professional services, not feature restrictions.
faq.q2Title: What if I don't need paid services?
faq.q2Answer: That's perfectly fine! Use Barbacane freely, contribute to the project if you can, and reach out when you need help. Our documentation, GitHub issues, and community channels are available to everyone.
faq.q3Title: Can you help with compliance requirements?
faq.q3Answer: Absolutely. Our consulting packages include compliance reviews for SOC 2, GDPR, HIPAA, and other frameworks. We help you configure Barbacane's logging, security policies, and audit trails to meet your requirements.
faq.q4Answer: Barbacane is designed to run anywhere — on-prem, in your cloud, at the edge. We can help you design and implement the deployment architecture that fits your infrastructure and security requirements.
